ACT
8.  
Action for declaration of unworthiness to succeed
In the case of a dispute, a court may declare a person unworthy to succeed at the request of an interested person.
The limitation period of a claim specified in subsection 1 of this section is six months after becoming aware of the reasons for unworthiness to succeed, but not longer than ten years from the date of opening of the succession.
The request specified in subsection 1 of this section may be made after the opening of a succession. The request specified in subsection 1 may be made with respect to a subsequent successor as soon as an estate transfers to a provisional successor.
